intro: Trisema wagapii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow blooms that appear in clusters, often resembling a misty cloud, hence its common name. Trisema wagapii typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
